text: The Lone Star Conference Men's Basketball Tournament is the annual conference basketball championship tournament for the Lone Star Conference. The tournament has been held annually since 1981. It is a single-elimination tournament and seeding is based on regular season records. The winner, declared conference champion, receives the Lone Star Conference's automatic bid to the NCAA Men's Division II Basketball Championship. ==Results== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Year !Champions !Score !Runner-Up !Venue |- align=center | 1975 |Sam Houston State |83–74 |Howard Payne |Brownwood, TX |- align=center | 1976 |Howard Payne |74–68 |Angelo State |Brownwood, TX |- align=center | 1977 |East Texas State |77–66 |Howard Payne |Brownwood, TX |- align=center | 1978 |East Texas State |76–71 |Howard Payne |Brownwood, TX |- align=center | 1979 |Southwest Texas State |70–69 |East Texas State |Huntsville, TX |- align=center | 1980 |Southwest Texas State |70–61 |Texas A&I; |Huntsville, TX |- align=center | 1981 |Sam Houston State |89–76 |Howard Payne |Huntsville, TX |- align=center | 1982 |Sam Houston State |53–50 |Stephen F.
